formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: 1) Annual contribution cap \[ C_{\max} = \min\big(C_{\text{desired}},\ C_{\text{IRS}},\ \text{Compensation}\big),\quad C_{\text{IRS}} = \begin{cases} 8000 & \text{if age} \ge 50 \\[4pt] 7000 & \text{if age} < 50 \end{cases} \] 2) Deduction phase-out (linear) \[ D = \begin{cases} C_{\max} & \text{if MAGI} \le L \\[4pt] 0 & \text{if MAGI} \ge U \\[4pt] C_{\max}\cdot\Big(1 - \dfrac{\text{MAGI}-L}{U-L}\Big) & \text{if } L < \text{MAGI} < U \end{cases} \] where \(L,U\) depend on filing status and coverage (2025 IRS ranges). 3) Future value of level annual contributions \[ FV = C_{\max}\cdot \frac{(1+r)^{n}-1}{r} \] with \(r\) = expected annual return and \(n\) = years of contributions. 4) After-tax value at retirement \[ \text{AfterTax} = FV - t_{\text{ret}}\cdot\big(FV - \text{Basis}\big) \] where \(\text{Basis} = n\cdot(C_{\max}-D)\) is total nondeductible contributions and \(t_{\text{ret}}\) is the retirement tax rate.

variables.meaning: property tax (annual or monthly depending on input)
